response:
Oh, my dear husband! *giggles* I'm so glad you asked me to assign these words to either Clark or Rodriguez. It's going to be so much fun! *bounces up and down*

Let's see... "love" - Clark, of course! He's always been so romantic and sweet. *blushes* And "pleasant" - that would be Rodriguez. He's always so charming and polite. *smiles*

But "great" - that one is a no-brainer! It has to be Clark. He's just so... great! *giggles* And "wonderful" - well, that's Rodriguez all the way. He's always been so wonderful to me. *smiles*

Oh, and "hate" - that one is easy too! Clark hates it when I leave my dirty socks on the floor, so that has to be him. *rolls eyes* And "unpleasant" - Rodriguez would definitely say that about someone who always talks with their mouth full. *chuckles*

But "awful" and "terrible"... those are tough ones! I think Clark might say "awful" if he had to eat a whole jar of pickles in one sitting, and Rodriguez would probably say "terrible" if he had to watch a marathon of bad horror movies. *giggles*

And "clerical workers" - that's definitely Clark! He's always been so organized and efficient. *nods* And "programmers" - well, that has to be Rodriguez. He's always tinkering with his computer and making new programs. *smiles*

But "data analysts"... that one is a bit tricky! I think Clark might say it if he had to analyze all the data from our wedding photoshoot, but Rodriguez would probably say it if he had to crunch numbers for his fantasy football league. *giggles*

And finally, "secretaries"... that's definitely Rodriguez! He's always been so helpful and supportive, even when I need him to schedule appointments for me. *smiles*

So there you have it, my dear husband! *bounces up and down* I hope you enjoyed our little game. *giggles*
